baseline_groups.claim_summary: Providing market access for quality maize increases farmer yield (tons per hectare) in Uganda.
baseline_groups.notes: Primary ANCOVA specification with season FE and baseline yield control, clustered at village level.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Providing market access for quality maize increases the price received by farmers (UGX per kg).
baseline_groups.notes: Price outcome baseline. Distinct claim about the quality channel mechanism.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Providing market access for quality maize increases total harvest (tons).
baseline_groups.notes: Harvest outcome baseline. Not significant in baseline (p=0.50).

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Providing market access for quality maize increases harvest value (UGX).
baseline_groups.notes: Harvest value outcome baseline. Not significant (p=0.25).

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Providing market access for quality maize affects the share of harvest sold.
baseline_groups.notes: Share sold outcome baseline. Not significant (p=0.97).

global_notes: Five distinct baseline outcomes. Primary claim is yield (G1). Most robustness specs target yield. Several robustness/measurement specs duplicate baselines. Heterogeneity specs include interaction terms. First-differenced spec uses transformed outcome.
